newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London lifted by U.S. ECI data.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London lifted by U.S. ECI data.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks in London moved forward on Tuesday after crucial U.S. wage inflation data came in lower than expected, traders said.
The Hang Seng London Reference Index was up 67.19 points at 13,403.29 by 1435 GMT, continuing an overnight rally by the Hang Seng in Hong Kong.
"Everything's a touch better here," one trader said. "I think we're going to see it (the Hang Seng) go up from here."
The U.S. employment cost index (ECI) was up 0.8 percent for the fourth quarter of 1996 versus expectations of 0.9 percent.
"Everyone was sitting on their hands ahead of these figures and now they're out I think buyers will move in," the trader said.
After CITIC Pacific Ltd said overnight it would acquire a substantial stake in China Light & Power, trading in both companies was suspended in London.
Traders said the announcement was good news for China Light and its share price would rally further once trading in the stock resumed.
-- Paul Carrel, London Newsroom +44 171 542 8958 (c) Reuters Limited 1997
